hints.content: For each value of $t$, the first object's position is the $y$-coordinate on the $\blue{\text{blue}}$  graph. The second object's position is the $y$-coordinate on the $\green{\text{green}}$ graph.
If the two objects collide at a particular value of $t$, the two graphs must have the same $y$-coordinate at that $t$-coordinate: they must intersect.
We're looking for the first $t$-coordinate where the two graphs intersect.
The graphs intersect at $(27.87,3.36)$, so the objects will collide after about $28$ seconds.

question.content:
The vertical positions of two objects are given by the functions $T(t) = 0.3t - 5$ and $E(t) = e^{-0.1t+4}$. Both objects are moving along the same surface.

**Estimate the value of $t$ when the objects first collide, within $2$ seconds.**

![](https://ka-perseus-graphie.s3.amazonaws.com/d4d546ae409cd18e910bdbc40e778e6c54db4363.png)

[[â˜ƒ input-number 1]] seconds
